sources.title: Violated (1953) SEEDY SHOCKER
sources.description:
It's FRIDAY @PizzaFLIX 
Score by: Tony Mottola
Starring: Wim Holland. Lili Dawn, Vicki Carlson

A series of bizarre crimes have New York City detectives on edge in this lurid thriller from first-and-only-time director Walter Strate. Famed Jazz guitarist Tony Mottola gets top billing for his flamenco meets burlesque score. Future grindhouse producer William P. Mishkin received his first movie credit for his highly original screenplay. And the gritty streets of New York provide a slice of the Big Apple circa 1953. If you prefer your PizzaFLIX on the seedy side, this one might be for you.

sources.title: 1953 - Violated - Walter Strate - VO - Versi√≥n Original

metadata.Plot: Filmed in New York City and intended for the niche market from art houses to back-street grind houses, with most of the distribution landing in the latter, "Violated" is the story of a serial/sex killer, Jan C. Verbig (Wim Holland), whose M.O. is cropping the hair of his victims. His love and pursuit of a burlesque dancer leads to his downfall and capture. A psychiatrist uses a truth serium to find the reasons for his abnormal behaviour.
metadata.Actors: William Holland, Lili Dawn, Mitchell Kowall
